summary: This is an email chain from November 28, 2021, among prosecutors in the Southern District of New York, discussing the upcoming opening statements in the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes a motivational message about the importance of the case and logistical details for attending the trial.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: Addressed in an email wishing him good luck with the opening statements in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial the next day.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal trial 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell', accused of sexually exploiting underage girls.

connections.description: Andrew is a prosecutor for the United States Attorney's Office bringing the case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Opening Statements in Maxwell Trial
events.description: Scheduled opening statements in the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, following peremptory challenges and preliminary instructions.

locations: 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email expresses the prosecutorial stance that 'It is never too late for justice,' directly contrasting with an implied reference to the earlier Florida case against Jeffrey Epstein.
The prosecution's opening argument asserts that 'Ghislaine Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls' and 'caused unspeakable harm to vulnerable kids.'
The trial involves 'brave women' taking the witness stand to testify about historical abuse.
Logistical details indicate high public or office interest, with a main courtroom and four overflow courtrooms designated for the opening statements.
The communication is internal among staff of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
